descript.abstract:
This dataset represents road centerlines for all public roads within the state of Minnesota. The roads are broken from intersection to intersection and attributed with information based on their designated route. Key attribute fields include route system (Interstate, US Highway, Minnesota Highway, County State Aid Highway, County Road, Township Road, etc.), Route Number (35W, 10, 53), and Name. A detailed description of the Roads layer attributes is included in Section 5 of this document - Entity and Attribute Overview.
Some route numbers are temporary. '900' Routes are for route segments that formerly were part of a trunk highway which was turned back to a local entity. These are temporary numbers assigned while MnDOT waits for an official local designation. These numbers are assigned in the 900-999 range and are not official route numbers but just for temporarily assigning data to unnumbered routes.
descript.purpose:
This dataset was developed to fill a need at MnDOT for a continuous, statewide GIS base map of the transportation system. It is part of the Transportation Information Sytem (TIS).
***This data is anticipated to be deprecated by late 2016. Replacement data will have new Route IDs and more accurate measures based off the cartographic lengths.***

timeperd.current: The data represent the route network as reported to MnDOT following the construction season ending in 2012. There are no plans to update the data provided on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons until the replacement data is available, anticipated in late 2016.

theme.themekey: Transportation, Roads, TIS Code, Route Number, Route Direction, Routes

idinfo.useconst: By accepting this data, the user agrees not to transmit this data or provide access to it or any part of it to another party or the public unless the user shall include with the data a copy of the disclaimer. The disclaimer can be found in Section 6 of this document (Distribution Liability). ***This data is anticipated to be deprecated in late 2016. Replacement data will have new Route IDs and more accurate measures based off the cartographic lengths. ***
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.6.1500

attracc.attraccr: We use the best resource available at the time of the attribute updates. Ideally this would be from the local municipalities or a construction plan but sometimes it comes from a variety of different sources.

dataqual.logic: Data have been topologically structured and verified.
dataqual.complete: The layer is complete for the entire state of Minnesota.

horizpa.horizpar: Location accuracy for features derived from USGS 7.5-minute quadrangles cannot be assumed to exceed National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:24,000 scale maps (+/- 40 feet or 12 meters). Accuracy of updates based on imagery is dependent on the resolution of the imagery used. Imagery used for updates would represent the best imagery available at the time of the update. Features updated by MnDOT or local highway agencies have higher positional accuracy.

procstep.procdesc:
The original data source for the MnDOT Basemap Roads features was the USGS 1:24,000-scale USGS 7.5-minute quadrangle maps.
During the time period 1990-1995, the Roads and other MnDOT BaseMap data layers were digitized from USGS 7.5-minute quadrangles using MicroStation CADD. A total of 1745 quadrangles were digitized. For any given area, MnDOT used the most recent quadrangle available at that time. The digital MicroStation CADD files were converted from State Plane Coordinates to UTM and then converted into ARC/INFO coverages. The ARC/INFO files were merged into statewide, seamless coverages and then attributes were added.
Beginning in March, 1999, the Roads features were checked and updated, using 1997 digital orthophotos for Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington Counties and 1991 digital orthophotos for the remaining 80 counties.
The Roads features layer is updated continuously as information comes in to the Office of Transportation System Management. The Minnesota Trunk Highway (TH), County State Aid System (CSAH), and Municipal State Aid System (MSAS) alignments and route data are improved each year through our annual status process. Changes to roads come from several sources including county engineers, city engineers, GIS personnel and the MnDOT State Aid office (which manages county state aid highways and municipal state aid streets), the most recent aerial photos available, and construction plans.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate not included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: Displays the full street name. This is concatenated from STREET_PREFIX, BASE_NAME, STREET_TYPE and STREET_SUFFIX.
Displays the prefix portion of the STREET_NAME. In the example: "N Jackson St W", the STREET_PREFIX would be "N". No periods are used.

Displays the name portion of the STREET_NAME. In the example: "N Jackson St W", the BASE_NAME would be "Jackson". No periods are used and normally abbreviated words like Saint and Fort are spelled out.

Displays the type portion of the STREET_NAME. In the example: "N Jackson St W", the STREET_TYPE would be "St". No periods are used. Valid abbreviations are set by the US Post Office and can be found on their website at: https://www.usps.com/send/official-abbreviations.htm
Displays the suffix portion of the STREET_NAME. In the example: "N Jackson St W", the STREET_SUFFIX would be "W". No periods are used.
Indicates if the street name is the official E-911 name for the street.

edom.edomvd: No street name known so populated with a number

attr.attrdefs: The unique identifier for the entire route within the state, using the following format: RRJJJJNNNNA where, RR = Route_System, JJJJ = Jurisdiction, defined as below based on Route_System (01, 02, 03 = 0000; 05, 10 = City Census Code; All others = XX00 where XX is XX = TIS County Code), NNNN = Route Number padded with leading zeros, and A = Alpha code on the end of particular routes or blank if none is present. *This code will be deprecated in early 2015.*
The Route System of the Route. Defined by the jurisdiction of the road.

This displays the number or letter of the road. For example, the route number for "County Road 22" would be "22", and the route number for "County Road F" would be "F". The ROUTE_NUMBER field also includes trailing letters. For example, the route number for "Interstate 35W" would be "35W".

edom.edomvd: The section of pavement is one half of a route divided by a physical median of some type.
The section of the route allows one way travel only.
This section of the route allows travel in two directions.

attr.attrdefs: The direction of traffic flow along this segment of pavement.

edom.edomvd: The traffic flows towards the direction of decreasing mileage only.
The traffic flows towards the direction of increasing mileage only.

attr.attrdefs: The unique identifier for the entire route within the state in the increasing direction unless it is a decreasing one way, using the following format: RRJJJJNNNNA where, RR = Route_System, JJJJ = Jurisdiction, defined as below based on Route_System (01, 02, 03 = 0000; 05, 10 = City Census Code; All others = XX00 where XX is XX = TIS County Code), NNNN = Route Number padded with leading zeros, and A = Alpha code on the end of particular routes or blank if none is present. *This code will be deprecated in early 2015.*

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

stdorder.ordering: Data can be downloaded from the Minnesota Geospatial Commons. See Online Linkage field below.
